clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and low disease activity receive csDMARD monotherapy or csDMARD combination (double or triple) therapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and low disease activity
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 6 months; assessed with: DAS 28-ESR (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -1.17)

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirecteness. The population has moderate disease activity.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and low disease activity receive csDMARD monotherapy or csDMARD combination (double or triple) therapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and low disease activity
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 6 months; assessed with: ACR 20)

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirecteness. The population has moderate disease activity.

Annotation.data:
1. csDMARD triple therapy includes MTX + SSZ + HCQ.
2. csDMARD monotherapy includes MTX.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and low disease activity receive csDMARD monotherapy or csDMARD combination (double or triple) therapy?
population: Patients with MTX-naïve and non-MTX csDMARDs exposed RA and low disease activity
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 6 months; assessed with: ACR 70)

Indirectness.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious indirecteness. The population has moderate disease activity.

Imprecision.rationales: Downgraded by one level due to serious imprecision. Confidence interval includes both values suggesting no effect and values suggesting harm. Low number of events.

Annotation.data:
1. csDMARD triple therapy includes MTX + SSZ + HCQ.
2. csDMARD monotherapy includes MTX.

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio
